21821212A9DA451887634F53C834955F.description: Set goals to improve viewing, listening, speaking and representing.

A6F5393F38104E179A7CC41E1D25CEB9.description: Choose and apply strategies appropriate to improvement goals and reflect on progress in achieving those goals.

A33EA42EBF0A4546A04284B7338A501E.description: State appropriate and achievable improvement goals based on self-analysis.

01CA74E53355441384482B9D32816BF6.description: Identify and analyze effectiveness of a variety of language strategies.

115FDE7BA3A94EB294A2E1EC93AEA070.description: Appraise own and others’ work for clarity.

3913339F18DE4BCABE6FD0B72478226D.description: Generate and use criteria to self-assess and set goals for improvement as a speaker, presenter, viewer and listener.

4D114674036B4B41A228F7B9EF59AE21.description: Assess use of language and selected strategies and revise personal goals to enhance language learning.

B9966D889BF94A9680D35C9D5AFB2031.description: Reflect on speaking, listening, representing and viewing experiences.

D523F00296D3439DB0932F1FBF351DB5.description: Use the strategies appropriate for a given task and situation.

3574BC7A7A5E45AEAB3BE2FD1B344A47.description: Assess personal strengths and needs within the development of language learning as they relate to family, community and land and set goals for future improvement, with guidance.

A9B8A288D5D44C6A84E1892C6FB71FB5.description: Develop and use criteria for evaluating self and preparing an action plan.

1A845EBD0F8D4E1090DAF175F2212EB8.description: Evaluate the quality of own contributions to group process and set goals using a self-evaluation tool (created by self or with peers and/or teacher) and plans for development.

03049ADE92DC45F2999E3B185487605E.description: Reflect on identity through the Nakoda worldview and language by asking questions (e.g., How does my use of Nakoda shape the way I understand nature? How does my use of Nakoda shape the way I understand the Nakoda culture?).

04EA4F6DF53F42A384C89E3E31CD2032.description: Assess personal strengths and needs for language learning as they relate to family, community and land.

155B7AF8A01C4FDDB5686A29ABA4C261.description: Outline similarities and differences between people, objects or situations (e.g., spring and fall) activities using T charts or Venn diagrams.

20F2745A1CBF4F5E9FB74C61D7D3E4D5.description: Describe events and experiences in logical progression (e.g., how berry picking is gathered in spring/summer, or how to care for horses, how different groups of people interacted with one another).

1AC477D89BEF4E4CA7B646F0D61C7DD0.description: Explain a procedure to describe what is done and why, such as how and why people heat their drums before they play, or why tobacco is left in the ground when earth medicines are taken from the land.

628CBE96B2AC47D686827C8E393722FA.description: Perform language functions, with guidance, to produce discourse in Nakoda

798C256A3F5F428F9E8E7CD0C85652AA.description: Conduct a language survey as a class or group project to survey Nakoda speakers (e.g., gather information about population, age, first or second language speakers).

07BF1DEB8AAE48C8A34EEB54017994AD.description: Use information gathered to prepare a project or plan for an outing.

AA2E55D2C07B4110AF254B61E9B7397A.description: Record information in various forms, such as written, visual or audio.

2AA052FF5D754430A189EB7848C6DBAE.description: Organize, condense and summarize data using a variety of representations (e.g., webs, charts, drawings).

7F1B5E7A4AE841DABCC8F8F379A2C88C.description: Decide where and how to find information including print and non-print resources such as internet, TV, radio, resource people, books, trading post, or store.

0F17C9BAA5854CAE8C1EE3805BC0DA13.description: Discuss and plan ways to obtain information or assistance from others (e.g., peers, helpers, leaders in the community) for a variety of purposes.

AE9469F39E9D466FA2CD29D8FEC1E10F.description: Perform language functions in Nakoda, with guidance, to gather information.

075CB82433BD491F93028924A3344144.description: Compare self to a character or situation in moral stories using a graphic organizer (e.g., Venn diagram, chart).

42463E0B931440979630D0A88AACA69C.description: Recognize and explain language techniques used for effectiveness, such as accompanying songs, clarity of vocabulary chosen using visual representation (e.g., illustrations, graphs, accessories).

0E65CEB0EFA043A38B56E5C1B9CD19D3.description: Identify and describe the main character(s), the main problem or the purpose.

79F0B7A015184A04884699BEA328878D.description: Examine causes and effects of decisions made by characters.

5D557602CB4247FDBE733641072201ED.description: Compile and organize details, such as the sequence of events or steps, after hearing/viewing/reading discourse.

DA42EF703617464FBA532FA05EFC5D2D.description: Predict what the discourse will be about using background knowledge about subject or from previewing and pre-listening activities directed by the teacher.

4AB8FC50F8E944D986898DB371907906.description: Interpret discourse in Nakoda by choosing the appropriate language function, with guidance.

8B1CB8948D7C421C8E075EA6167906A6.description: Prepare in groups, topics that will be discussed and questions that can be asked when Elders are present to share their knowledge.

EFF6A8B39DEA4540888F7451D160816C.description: Express basic personal emotions and moods.

E029B1370088426D9AC7DCB27929ED3B.description: Recognize gestures and expressions that accompany requests from friends, adults and unfamiliar adults.

C4314E3B27104F018A50E50862FE193D.description: Give instructions in a polite way according to conventions of Nakoda and community.

186FE552F32844F094F70D28F3C6CA7F.description: Use expressions and phrases for informal conversation in cooperative groups.

5317E2808E3A49C9B6C64040B235C9E1.description: Use gestures such as the Plains Sign Language that accompany play.

C799221C4BB942ABB274DAF844AB7A41.description: Perform language functions, with guidance, to socialize and celebrate in Nakoda.

0A2EDA508EA740C3AD996A418A8C49E5.description: Participate in conversations that include habitual aspect (-h?), durative aspect (-ga), or potential/future mood (-kta).

153D6F9EEBF24AEBB609F15E451313FB.description: Share and justify opinions and preferences.

10CA0072D3C8444FB51040BA966C7E81.description: Follow instructions involving several objects and actions (e.g., learn to dance, jig or prepare food).

C6AFF5FFC7BE443482C88801851CD8A9.description: Ask for specific help to complete a task.

4481A4A1698F4E13AC7D01694BCB4C04.description: Ask and respond to questions about logical relations such as cause, conditional, contrast and conjunction (e.g., Bill dóki iyáya he? Where is Bill going?”, Nih?? dóki he? Where is our mother?”).

8A644215CAB845AE9BDA683192D6F3B0.description: Ask and respond to questions of clarification about “who did what to what/whom”, Duwé žé ec?? he?

8A76E5CD8B794FF09642887F5EE3CCDD.description: Ask and respond to questions of clarification about action or movement (e.g., frequency, duration, direction).

79A9FB4C36F748C9AA0557B6439F06D3.description: Ask and respond to questions of clarification about objects (e.g., directions, prices, purpose, location).

64F2B614ACA244C9BFECF715E7B440C5.description: Use learned expressions in a variety of contexts.

3E805FCD4AF14B44860E7A2E07020DE9.description: Explore and use formal and informal language and behaviours in a variety of contexts.

EFCA0C444ADA4EE48DADB5BDA845357A.description: Follow simple instructions for doing something (e.g., brush teeth, wash face, write on the board).

959817687E70475A8877637036EFEB3E.description: Use a combination of simple social interaction patterns to perform transactions and interactions (e.g., invitation, accepting, non-accepting, explaining, extending, writing) specific to the Nakoda culture.

4E64330F5E5148D4984E758E35D6F1B7.description: Perform language functions, with guidance, to receive and give information in Nakoda.

4F55E25F4A4C46E9BFC42D7960EE7BA5.description: Give examples of various words and expressions that convey the same idea.

54BBE923EC4B41C3AB4B5A53C4501642.description: Sequence elements of a simple story, process or series of events.

949373D8499C403387A17BD6C861CBFB.description: Link words or groups of words in simple ways.

D9DEF490662E478196C0D26E7BB53E74.description: Produce responses to simple questions in several different ways.

40612508477346BAB30A9EEE6084F95A.description: Produce several short sentences using basic words, phrases, questions, and simple language structures.

299AA088D0124F4D9F860FA3384EBDE7.description: Produce several short sentences spontaneously to express an idea, using coherency markers.

E83469F972544082B84CB666D2A4330B.description: Communicate coherently in Nakoda, with guidance.

9EA12BA9F79243088F4A9822CC6EA08D.description: Use intonation, stress and rhythm appropriately.

7E6F459E90EE42CFB0E70C42C3527C1E.description: Give examples of various words or expressions that convey the same idea.

62F3C49972114D5E8E8ABDB9C135D847.description: Demonstrate awareness that one word may have multiple meanings depending on the context.

107546A301764359886C60376C0A5FC2.description: Use pronunciation and grammar that is understandable in familiar situations.

B84F368055834339AC24C3BFFD1080BD.description: Use precise verbs such as, iyód?ga ‘sit’, now?? ‘sing’ ??’á ‘laugh’ in most common situations.

A740EE5AFCA24E4A93BAAB050952DF86.description: Communicate proficiently in Nakoda, with guidance.

D81E13F74DC746DDAB156D3A7F9A9080.description: Use a repertoire of words and phrases in the classroom within a variety of contexts such as world of work, living things, shopping, extracurricular activities, plants and seasons and entertainment.

64BF6927302748E78AA31959FB2871A5.description: Identify and explain a variety of references (e.g., nouns, verbs, space, time) within texts.

74CDEC0721C142FC916376D8F0DDDB96.description: Present steps of a procedure or follow directions.

DB6DD8343A3E4942A8B9C953E57E31AA.description: Listen and respond to a variety of short, simple oral sentences in situations by answering or questioning (e.g., Dóken ya’??? ‘How are you?’ D?y?? wa’??. ‘I am fine.’).

7C553B16C0944B8885275B6694E601DC.description: Use sentences with one verb and a subject.

9F5C9C2C75904D4195409D26E60C05DE.description: Use imperative verbs of command in appropriate contexts.

66F1E84D4D9E4C3D803DE1AAE7B285ED.description: Use correct word order in short utterances and basic constructions.

7E45C6881FFE4DB4B11C211ED5083E98.description: Use common regular verbal affixes of the four classes of verbs with accuracy. wóada ‘I eat’, mnúda ‘I take’, ecám? ‘I do it’, mayáz? ‘I am sick’, wóyada ‘you eat’, núda ‘you take’, ecán? ‘you do it’, and niyáz? ‘you are sick’.

ED528CBF2A4C4D8B87995BB8EC29B3C5.description: Understand and use specific vocabulary associated with daily life when interacting with classmates, teacher, composing a written assignment and presenting orally.

A3A613C1A9BC48CEB4F052DB2E60E727.description: Communicate accurately, with guidance, using syntactical and semantical connections of Nakoda.

283CB4E21C3444578FE641EBED4F77BF.description: Use note taking to write down key terms or concepts (e.g., split page notes, write down key term on one side and meaning of the term on the other).

2F572156AD9546059A156B193A7A3C71.description: Use support strategies to help peers persevere at learning task.

F2B70D557EE64D0AB877AB2157A6C86F.description: Summarize the point reached in a discussion to help focus a task.

E74BA87E665A4DF4A8C3F52082BA5B48.description: Repeat part of what someone has said to confirm mutual understanding.

D52F67D33BE843529E754B926BCE2372.description: Use suitable phrases to intervene in a discussion (e.g., What do you think about ...? Could you tell me more about ...? I wonder about ...”).

92C19718122C4986B53293ABE06D9854.description: Take part in group decision-making by informing and sharing suggestions with others.

075B64EC469A4C51A6106238E1AFCD8B.description: Formulate key questions to guide inquiry.

9D6B5B05C80B443C83971EECC46F3CED.description: Assess own performance or comprehension at the end of a task by answering questions such as, “Did I ask an entire question, or did I answer the question correctly? What other way could I have said what I did?”.

8B06E7013F5746F59BC968775B04679D.description: Divide the overall learning task into sub-tasks (i.e., prefix and suffix).

03AB8B7034BA4E03A4C0BAD01C6BA12B.description: Distinguish between fact and opinion of Nakoda perspectives when using a variety of sources of information (e.g., Elders, books, archives, television, digital).

73B3EC3857274F8ABB858C318B77549D.description: Analyze an unfamiliar word through its word parts and the context to comprehend.

2E9C9842124B44A9B142B6D3CAD8B3B1.description: Create graphic organizers (e.g., word webs, tables) to remember groups of words or patterns.

4FF1D058F415456594597847962EB956.description: Use words and expressions in different ways when intended language is not available.

9AE15977D2094531B9129F1C22B537A1.description: Sustain prolonged interaction with pauses to formulate oral text and to self-correct.

EF3DEC13EC4B4861ADC9E54C2F166A8F.description: Plan what and how to communicate a message in everyday conversations.

0F6C575B82E745739E51ADCB72477D41.description: Ask questions for clarification and recognize when understanding breaks down.

40270067985F4D16BD8A44F4B7BB50CE.description: Identify the purpose or intent of a message.

7B8705A7BC4C486285FA36E81FC07D37.description: Use available technological aides to support language learning (e.g., websites, podcasts, recordings).

A29964100B9A4F838C0CDDF0CC11ED09.description: Associate new words or expressions with familiar ones using Nakoda.

ED96B65529A045CDBEC0A817EFF8AEFF.description: Use repetition to imitate Nakoda language when practising words or phrases.

00C32E45D4B4433A9FB078DB839519D3.description: Select and use, with guidance, appropriate strategies to construct meaning and communicate, including language cues and conventions.

A3632303EE384133A41C53ABD5A896D4.description: Explore outdoors to become familiar with the weather and environment to strengthen vocabulary.

36D83F55283C47F1A0F2E779907A4D24.description: Participate in ceremonies or feasts by extracting the words known and then discuss the meaning.

6EDB392841AD450FAD361BADCC5B8893.description: Use Plains Sign Language along with Nakoda language.

9874E2A5D2A1451580E7F6AE1DFA4883.description: Use nonverbal communication in a variety of contexts (e.g., shrugging shoulders, pointing with lips).

65B7DAC2DD7947A588CECA5A20F079FC.description: Use nonverbal communication in a variety of contexts (e.g., shrugging shoulders, pointing with lips).

4251938656284A9C912975E219BD99E8.description: Use politeness conventions in a variety of contexts (e.g., using suitable language to engage listeners’ attention when beginning to speak).

80A3675F555E4A7D9EDDD11F644723FB.description: Identify and produce uses of common regional or other variations in the Nakoda language.

BE96FC298DB24E668F6EBC258945681A.description: Use expressions to illustrate differences in register (e.g., formal vs. informal).

DE01FC6D0226442EBCE791C89144D440.description: Use Nakoda vocabulary to describe a visual display of culture (e.g., prepare food or hides).

A0575799374F421CACF74AB91D030286.description: Communicate personal feelings on topics of study or experiences using a variety of mediums, such as video, art, music and narratives.

F410014FBBD04B78B56C1D54E74E91D4.description: Retell parts of oral narratives using a variety of traditional and contemporary mediums to support the retelling such as drama, dance, music or visual art.

280DD8BC789E4F0EBDF3ECFE4A71E226.description: Present oral forms of simple and short contemporary Nakoda reflections, such as songs, short entertaining films, short stories and recipes using land foods.

F0FCC6C51E714AD08E0E444CF056C224.description: Explain and follow rules, routines, and procedures related to a specific activity (e.g., playing a sport, preparing a meal, planning a meeting).

0745361546A14C96ADEB85DE68D29FC2.description: Express some emotions and feelings familiar to the classroom (e.g., role-playing, talking circles).

55E0B759E9AE46CABF21DE122444E209.description: Identify and use terms related to kinship.

5C5D6F4A829D452D93C2202B302E60A5.description: Produce, with guidance, simple oral texts on familiar topics in Nakoda.

9D0A615AC4DD48C092B11ADF56B17C8F.description: Discuss selected topics providing some details to support main idea.

D864999ED90D427BA68BD6514DEEB00D.description: Discuss selected topics providing some details to support main idea.

B9D43E9807F94B08A8E5CA2E3C6D3C52.description: Respond to the main point and some supporting details of oral texts on a variety of familiar topics.

90FE11EE11364C3BB8322D7B4D1E2AC0.description: Share and explain examples of short and simple excerpts using stories from the oral tradition.

87BAFDF6FF4C438183CDC92A5A80A0C9.description: Use language creatively and for a variety of purposes (e.g., listening to music, listening to jokes, viewing dances, personal enjoyment).

3DC470B0C13C4B019D5DEFCB14F23F1E.description: Explain digitally or in person, short and simple oral excerpts from the oral tradition of the people, relating to areas of local lifestyles in the past and present (e.g., histories, biographies, moral stories, songs, entertainment stories).

A61D912B95E24FB1A02B35DA9DDF316C.description: Construct meaning, with guidance, of a variety of Nakoda simple oral fiction and non-fiction texts on familiar topics.

506ACD239BEA430E8B5031A418DCA43D.description: Respond to representation of ideas, events and information by creating a chart, illustrations or using technology.

E558E57F830743D8AB536468EDF1F00F.description: Respond to a variety of text forms including storytelling in a variety of media (e.g., recorded instructions or events, creating illustrations, respond in learning logs or questioning the author).

C5B4C3301D3C46F7A8FE058C0C40E7EF.description: Discuss and promote positive interactions and relationships in the school (e.g., how to engage with Elders).

4076B0BCC5A14730A5EFDE38DF43B2EC.description: Participate, with guidance, in developing language and culture during experiential learning opportunities, such as helping at community/cultural events, volunteering with child care children, visiting and conversing with Elders in the community, planning cultural camps/activities.

76327FAAACF3440CA6CC64E0D90D2A4C.description: Seek and record information to further understanding of Nakoda concepts from Elders and other knowledge keepers within the community.

4035AAF2C82D41D4A5658305BF669348.description: Interact with classmates in pairs or small groups, with guidance, to plan and complete class projects using the Nakoda language.

B25BA653330741C69C84C21CC2AF5AEA.description: Interact with classmates and teacher, with guidance, during learning activities using the Nakoda language.

B80DE563CF5648F2ACB775363E04296F.description: Communicate interactively in Nakoda, with guidance, to experience the natural and constructed environments of the community.
